text.section: A qualified organization may conduct a raffle in the county to benefit charity or to further the purpose of the qualified organization.

A raffle shall be conducted by a qualified organization and not by a person who:
retains a portion of the proceeds from the raffle; or
is compensated by the qualified organization for which the raffle is held.
A person may not receive a private profit from the proceeds of a raffle.
A person operating a raffle shall be a resident of the county and a member of the qualified organization.
Prizes of money or merchandise may be awarded in a raffle conducted under this subtitle.
For a raffle of real property, the requirements of this section are in addition to the requirements of § 12-106(a) of this article.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, a qualified organization may not conduct more than 12 raffles each year.
There is no limit to the number of 50/50 raffles that a qualified organization may conduct if the prize for each 50/50 raffle does not exceed $300.
